availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James W. Hollis (Anderson County Justice of the Peace and tollgate keeper)

body.p: Residence: Lawrenceburg, Anderson County, Kentucky. A Pennsylvania-born Justice of the Peace and tollgate keeper. War of 1812 veteran. Enlisted as private, Captain John Simpon's Company of the Kentucky Militia, 1 Aug 1812. Discharged 6 Mar 1813. Married Nancy McClaine, 3 Aug 1813, Shelby County, Kentucky.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County, Lawrenceburg post office, p. 31.

War of 1812 Pension Applications. Washington D.C.: National Archives. NARA Microfilm Publication M313, 102 rolls. Records of the Department of Veterans Affairs, Record Group Number 15, Microfilm Roll #46, index accessed at ancestry.com.
